meanings.definition: To guide or direct someone or something outward.
meanings.sent1: She outleading her friends to the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide outleading the group to the historical site.
meanings.sent3: The dog outleading its owner to the treat jar with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The sun outleading the flowers to bloom in the morning light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outleading the students through the museum, pointing out interesting facts.

meanings.definition: The act of leading or guiding someone or something outward.
meanings.sent1: His outleading of the team towards success was commendable.
meanings.sent2: The outleading of the hikers through the forest was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The outleading of the parade was filled with colorful floats and music.
meanings.sent4: The outleading of the river into the vast ocean was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The outleading of the students on the field trip was organized and educational.
